text: Anodos () is a term meaning either 'ascent, way up' () or 'pathless, having no road, impassable' (). It may refer to: *enlightenment, as used by Plato *the central character in George MacDonald's fantasy novel Phantastes (1858) *pseudonym used by the poet Mary Elizabeth Coleridge *the third phase ('ascent') of the cycle of Persephone's annual visit to Hades as imagined in the mythology and rites of the Eleusinian Mysteries *the creation of Pandora, the first woman in Greek mythology
title: Anodos
